translated: As It Was Said
The Tens
The First Section
Feigning Generosity

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, said by the Arahant, so I have heard:

original: “Nayidaṁ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṁ vussati janakuhanatthaṁ, na janalapanatthaṁ, na lābhasakkārasilokānisaṁsatthaṁ, na ‘iti maṁ jano jānātū’ti.
analyzed: na yida bhikkhave brahmacariyam vussati jana kuhanattha na jana lapanattha na lābha sakkāra silokānisasattha na iti mama janaḥ jānātu uti
translated: “Monks, this spiritual life is not lived for the sake of deceiving people, for the sake of winning arguments, for the sake of defeating others, for the sake of winning a debate, for the sake of acquiring material gain, honor, or fame, for the sake of being acknowledged as a great man.

original: Atha kho idaṁ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṁ vussati abhiññatthañceva pariññatthañcā”ti.
analyzed: atha kho idam bhikkhave brahmacariyam vussati abhiññattham ca iva pariññattham ca ati
translated: This spiritual life is lived for the sake of direct knowledge and complete understanding.”
The Blessed One said this.
And in connection with this, it was said:
“For the sake of direct knowledge and complete understanding,
the spiritual life is lived without pretense.
The Blessed One taught it,
leading to the penetration of extinguishment.
This is the path followed by the great ones,
by the great seers of the past.
Those who practice in accordance with it,
as taught by the Buddha,
will make an end to suffering and stress,
those who practice in accordance with the Teacher’s instructions.”

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: This is the meaning of what the Blessed One said. So it was heard by me.
The ninth.
